title: How to Cook Mughlai Paratha (Veg and Non Veg)

steps.headline: Make small balls of the dough.

steps.headline: Heat a shallow pan until a drop of water sizzles.

text: The Roti base Make small balls of the dough.  Flour your rolling pin and roll each ball out into a circle. Try to make it equal to the size of a small tortilla. Heat a shallow pan until a drop of water sizzles. Place a roti on the hot pan and lightly dry cook one side of the roti. (Indication: The roti should change color.) Take it off the pan and in the centre of the cooked side place the stuffing, almost in square form.  Fold the roti over the stuffing like an envelope. As you fold the bottom half over, wet the edges with a bit of water. Then fold in the left and right hand sides, and finally the top side. In the end, it should look like a square envelope. Heat oil in pan to about 350 F. Shallow fry the paratha, turning them once so that both sides are cooked.  Serve on a plate with yogurt or mint chutney.  Vegetarian Bean Stuffing In a wok or frying pan, heat oil. Add cumin seed. When the cumin seed starts to darken, add chopped onions, garlic and ginger. Sauté till the onion is light brown. Add the tomato puree, kidney beans, and salt to taste. Add red chili powder if using. Allow it to come to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer, and cook 10-15 minutes until mixture thickens.
